question: 1. If your monthly income were to double, how much more stuff would you be able to afford?
options: C. 3 times more
B. 2 times more
A. 1.5 times more
D. 4 times more

question: 2. What would happen if the monthly income of everyone else were to double as well?
options: B. You would still be able to afford 2 times more stuff
A. You would be able to afford even more stuff
C. You would be able to afford less due to price increases
D. Your income would also double
correct_answer: B. You would still be able to afford 2 times more stuff

question: 3. If your income doubles but everyone else's triples, what would happen to your purchasing power?
options: D. It depends on the specific goods and services
A. You can buy more stuff
C. You would stay the same
B. You would become poorer
correct_answer: D. It depends on the specific goods and services

question: 4. What is the relationship between inflation and the need for increased income?
options: C. Increased income leads to inflation
A. Inflation has no effect on income
B. Income must increase at least the same rate as inflation to avoid becoming poorer
D. The government controls income based on inflation levels
correct_answer: C. Increased income leads to inflation

question: 5. How many times less potatoes can each dollar buy you compared to 100 years ago?
options: A. 19 times less
B. 20 times less
D. 40 times less
C. 39 times less

question: 6. How has the affordability of coffee changed in the last 100 years?
options: B. 20 times less affordable
A. 19 times less affordable
C. 39 times less affordable
D. 40 times less affordable

question: 7. What is the general trend in the affordability of bread over the last century?
options: D. It has become unaffordable
A. It has become more affordable
B. It has stayed relatively constant
C. It has become less affordable

question: 9. What is the key concept behind maintaining purchasing power in the face of inflation?
options: A. Saving money is the best strategy
B. Increasing income at least at the rate of inflation
D. Ignoring inflation altogether
C. Buying as many goods and services as possible
correct_answer: A. Saving money is the best strategy

question: 10. In order to avoid becoming poorer in an inflationary environment, what must happen to your income?
options: B. It must increase at a slower rate than inflation
C. It must increase at the same rate as inflation
D. It must increase at a faster rate than inflation.
A. It must decrease
correct_answer: B. It must increase at a slower rate than inflation
